page.title: 03LIBRARY AT WINDSOR CASTLE
page.content: by David,Bradley Room 542 is the library at Windsor Castle.It is on two floors with a William IV ceiling,a long gallery built for Elizabeth I to walk in on rainy days.A half-spiral staircase leads to the upper floor. This is the third book collection begun in 1830. King George IV gave the first collection to the British Museum and it is called the King's Library.There are 50,000 books of historical topics, and a modern section of biographies, works on the present Royal Family,the Commonwealth.Books are not loaned very often;recently a bible belonging to General Gordan of the Sudan was loaned to the National Portrait Gallery for an exhibition. Books are not inter-changed with libraries in other Royal residences.The library is not open to the public:
